perturbation.original_text: 1.9 The Sub-Advisor shall act honestly, with due skill, care and diligence and fairly and in the best interest of the Partnership in carrying out its obligations under this Agreement and shall use all reasonable endeavours to perform its obligations under this Agreement in accordance with FSMA, the FCA Rules and any other laws, regulations, guidelines and guidance as may be in force from time to time and applicable to the Funds and their business or to the Sub-Advisor ("Applicable Law").
perturbation.changed_text: 1.9 The Sub-Advisor shall act honestly and fairly in carrying out its obligations under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the requirement for the Sub-Advisor to act with 'due skill, care, and diligence' and to use 'all reasonable endeavours to perform its obligations under this Agreement in accordance with FSMA, the FCA Rules and any other laws, regulations, guidelines and guidance'. This weakens the standard of care and compliance required of the Sub-Advisor, potentially violating FCA regulations that mandate a higher standard of care for financial service providers.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) Rules, specifically those related to the standard of care and compliance for regulated firms.

perturbation.original_text: 6.1 The Sub-Advisor shall maintain proper and complete records relating to the services to be provided under this Agreement for such period of time as may be required under Applicable Law, including (as applicable, in respect of the relevant Discretionary Funds) records with respect to the acquisition, holding and disposal of securities on behalf of the Funds, details of all brokers used and the aggregate dollar amount of brokerage commission paid in that regard to each broker.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.1 The Sub-Advisor shall maintain records relating to the services to be provided under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change omits the requirement to maintain 'proper and complete' records and removes the specific details required, such as 'records with respect to the acquisition, holding and disposal of securities', 'details of all brokers used' and 'the aggregate dollar amount of brokerage commission paid'. This weakens the record-keeping requirements, potentially violating FCA regulations that mandate specific and detailed record-keeping for regulated firms.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) Rules on record-keeping requirements for investment firms.

perturbation.original_text: 8.2 The Sub-Advisor hereby undertakes to Oaktree US that it will take all reasonable steps within its power to remain an authorised person for the purposes of FSMA in respect of the services to be provided by it hereunder, with a scope of permission which will permit it to carry out its obligations and exercise its powers under this Agreement, and that it will comply with those FCA Rules which apply to the services to be provided hereunder.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.2 The Sub-Advisor hereby undertakes to Oaktree US that it will comply with FCA Rules.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the Sub-Advisor's undertaking to 'take all reasonable steps within its power to remain an authorised person for the purposes of FSMA... with a scope of permission which will permit it to carry out its obligations'. This weakens the obligation of the Sub-Advisor to maintain its regulatory authorization, creating a potential conflict with FSMA regulations that require firms to maintain appropriate authorization to conduct regulated activities.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (FSMA) and related FCA Rules on authorization and scope of permission.
